listing.name: Exports for Trello by Blue Cat (CSV, Excel)
listing.description:
# Trello Export

**One of the [fastest growing power-ups of 2023](https://www.bluecatreports.com/blog/power-up-stats-2023/)**

Export from Trello by [Blue Cat](https://www.bluecatreports.com/) lets you export cards from Trello to CSV/Excel, or **set a schedule and get an email export when you want it**.

## How to export from Trello

![Export from Trello](https://exports.bluecatreports.com/listing/export-example.png)

1. Add the Trello Export Power-Up to your board
1. Pick the lists you want to export cards from
1. Click the **Download CSV** button to get your export

## Optional: Set a schedule and get your export emailed directly to you

![Export schedule](https://exports.bluecatreports.com/listing/schedule-example.png)

Paid users can also get exports sent directly to their inbox on a schedule they determine. Simply configure your schedule and we will run the export when you want it and email it to you. You can select daily, weekly or monthly exports and choose the time of day we will create your export for you.

## Pricing

We have two simple options

- **FREE:** 10 Free exports, unlimited boards, custom field support
- **$19/month** Get everything in free plus unlimited exports and scheduled exports to save you time and make sure you never miss an export

## Exporting CSV, Excel, XLSX and Google Sheets data from Trello

Currently Exports by Blue Cat will create a CSV file. These files can easily be opened in Excel or Google sheets and converted to XLSX if required

- To open in Excel, open Excel and open the file the same way you would any other Excel file. You can save this as an XLSX file if you wish.
- To open in Google sheets, open Google sheets, create a new file and select Import. You can then import the CSV file from your computor.

Excel files saved as XLSX can be opened and imported. To import from Google Sheets you will need to save your file as a CSV file from google sheets, which can then be opened and imported.


## How to backup Trello boards for free

Exports by Blue Cat can be a great way to create backups of your Trello data, especially when combined with [Imports by Blue Cat](https://trello.com/power-ups/61fa6cd2cc14647c2c9ee821/import-to-trello-by-blue-cat-csv-excel) to reload the data. Simply use the free option to create a backup manually or start a paid subscription to create an export automatically on a schedule. The use Imports to import the data back into Trello if you lose anything.

## Once you're done exporting check out our other great tools

### [Blue Cat Reports](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat)

Our Reporting Power-Up is the number one reporting tool for Trello. There is a fully-featured 7-day free trial so give it a go and see the sort of reports you can create now all your data is in Trello. You can [check it out here](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat).

### [Imports](https://trello.com/power-ups/61fa6cd2cc14647c2c9ee821/import-to-trello-by-blue-cat-csv-excel)

Trello's most popular imports power-up, import data into all the standard Trello fields plus all of your Custom fields.

### [Forms by Blue Cat](https://trello.com/power-ups/6139de588901011c01baf52f/forms-by-blue-cat)

Do you need a way for people to fill out forms and get cards created in Trello? Then look no further. Our [Forms Power-Up](https://trello.com/power-ups/6139de588901011c01baf52f/forms-by-blue-cat) does just that, integrates with all the standard and custom Trello fields as well as attachments. 


## Our Trello guides

See our guide to [Every free Trello power-up](https://www.bluecatreports.com/free-trello-powerups/)

Check out our reviews of [Every Trello reporting power-up](https://www.bluecatreports.com/trello-reporting/)

listing.name: Import to Trello by Blue Cat (CSV, Excel)
listing.description:
# Trello Import

Trello Import by [Blue Cat](https://www.bluecatreports.com/) lets you import cards from CSV or Excel spreadsheets directly into your Trello boards.

*Hey! we're one of the [fastest growing power-ups of 2022](https://www.bluecatreports.com/blog/power-up-stats-2022/)*

## Watch the video!

We're very happy that Brittany from [How I Trello](https://trello.substack.com/) created this short video showing how to use the power-up. Check it out, or read on below if you prefer. 

[![](https://imports.bluecatreports.com/listing/imports_youtube.png)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZkPKD9TNy1M)

## How to import into Trello

![Select Excel, XLSX or CSV file to Import into Trello](https://imports.bluecatreports.com/listing/select-file.png)

1. Add the Trello Import Power-Up to your board
1. Open the CSV or Excel file you want to import
1. Select how to map your data into Trello
1. Click the import button and wait as we create all your cards for you

## Select how we map your data into Trello
![Field mapping for your Trello Import](https://imports.bluecatreports.com/listing/mappings.png)

For each column in your spreadsheet, you can select how we will import it into your Trello board. For data you don't want to match to a specific field in Trello you can simply add it to the card description.

If there is data we cannot import we will show that here so you can see what the issue is. You can expand sections to get additional information. To correct these errors you will either need to create the matching List/Label/Custom Field/etc on your Trello board or update your spreadsheet to change those values to match Trello. Or, you can ignore those issues and import the spreadsheet without that data.

## Importing CSV, Excel and Google Sheets data to Trello

Excel files saved as XLSX can be opened and imported. To import from Google Sheets you will need to save your file as a CSV file from google sheets, which can then be opened and imported.

The first row of the spreadsheet is used as headings so we know how to map the data into Trello. 

You can take a look at a [simple example spreadsheet here](https://imports.bluecatreports.com/listing/Example%20Import%20Spreadsheet.csv) or any export created from in Trello can be imported using this power-up

We can handle all of these field names, they will be mapped into Trello as described below. 

- name, title or card name: Any of these will be mapped to the **card name**
- description, card description or desc: Any of these will map to the **card description**
- list: the **name of the list** we should import this card into. If we cannot find that list the card is created in the first list on the board
- members: the names of the members to assign this card to
- labels: the names and/or colours of the labels to add to this card
- due or due date: maps to the card due date
- **Checklists**
 - Checklist: The **Checklist name** to import this checklist item into 
 - Checklist item: The **Checklist item name**
 - Checklist item due: The **due date** for this checklist item
 - Checklist item member: The **assigned member** for this checklist item

### Errors in your spreadsheets

We will let you know if any of the data cannot be mapped into Trello, if you are happy with that then you can ignore the warnings and import. If there are issues during the import those will be reported once the import is complete.


## Import a backup file to Trello

If you take a backup of your Boards using [Trello's export feature](https://www.bluecatreports.com/trello-reporting/exporting-trello-data/#trelloBoardExport) you can then use our free import tool to recreate any lost or changed data. Either import the entire spreadsheet to recreate everything, or edit it beforehand to select just the cards you want to recreate.

## Pricing

Imports by Blue Cat is **free for your first 10 imports**, after that it costs $19/month (or $190/year) for unlimited imports.

## Once you're done importing check out our other great tools

### [Blue Cat Reports](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat)

Our Reporting Power-Up is the number one reporting tool for Trello. There is a fully-featured 7-day free trial so give it a go and see the sort of reports you can create now all your data is in Trello. You can [check it out here](https://trello.com/power-ups/5d9c90aa18965066fcd44730/reports-by-blue-cat).

### [Forms by Blue Cat](https://trello.com/power-ups/6139de588901011c01baf52f/forms-by-blue-cat)

Do you need a way for people to fill out forms and get cards created in Trello? Then look no further. Our [Forms Power-Up](https://trello.com/power-ups/6139de588901011c01baf52f/forms-by-blue-cat) does just that, integrates with all the standard and custom Trello fields as well as attachments. 

### [Exports for Trello](https://trello.com/power-ups/646c9004a20404e02facd050/exports-for-trello-by-blue-cat-csv-excel)

Export your data from Trello, manually for free or pay to get scheduled exports direct to your inbox. Our [Exports Power-Up](https://trello.com/power-ups/646c9004a20404e02facd050/exports-for-trello-by-blue-cat-csv-excel) does just that.

## Our Trello guides

See our guide to [every free Trello power-up](https://www.bluecatreports.com/free-trello-powerups/)

Check out our reviews of [every Trello reporting power-up](https://www.bluecatreports.com/trello-reporting/)

listing.description:
![](https://itsdani.me/images/pretty-print/hr.png)

![demo-gif](https://itsdani.me/images/pretty-print/demo.gif)


# Pretty Print üñ®Ô∏è‚ú® 
![](https://itsdani.me/images/pretty-print/hr.png)


> Sometimes it's handy to just have all your cards and their descriptions in one list. Maybe you want to print out your cards or export them to PDF.
> 
> With this Power-Up, you can choose which lists you want. The list, all its cards, their labels, and their descriptions will appear, fully formatted, ready to print or save.


## ‚ö°Ô∏è Quick Start
![](https://itsdani.me/images/pretty-print/hr.png)

### 1. ‚ú® Click the *"Pretty Print"* board button.

![](https://itsdani.me/images/pretty-print/step1.gif)

### 2. ‚öôÔ∏è Adjust your preferences.

![](https://itsdani.me/images/pretty-print/step2.gif)

### 3. üñ®Ô∏è Print or üìù Export!

![](https://itsdani.me/images/pretty-print/step3.gif)

## üí° Tips
![](https://itsdani.me/images/pretty-print/hr.png)

 You can use this Power-Up to export your board into a nicely formatted PDF document. Instead of choosing a printer, select *"Save as PDF"* in your print settings:

![](https://itsdani.me/images/pretty-print/tip1.png)

üìÑ The default margins are set to: 

>üí† **Paper Size:** A4
>
>üí† **Top and Bottom Margins:** 0.25in
>
>üí† **Left and Right Margins:** 0

If you wish to change this, you can do so in the print settings (in Chrome, check the *"More Settings"* option):

![](https://itsdani.me/images/pretty-print/tip2.png)

If you don't like the amount of white space in your print preview, here are some things you can try:
    
>üí† Check or uncheck the box that says *"Start each list on a new page."*
>
>üí† Try printing out just 2-3 lists at a time. Sometimes this can help in grouping the lists more appropriately.

You can also disable the card colors to save printer ink! Just check the box that says *"Show card backgrounds"* and that formatting will disappear.

If you do want the colors to show up in print; however, make sure you double check your print settings and *turn on background graphics*:

![](https://itsdani.me/images/pretty-print/tip4.png)

## ‚ùì Help
![](https://itsdani.me/images/pretty-print/hr.png)

If you need assistance, feel free to get in touch:

>üí† Email: [karendlyle@gmail.com](mailto:karendlyle@gmail.com)
>
>üí† [Github Repository](https://github.com/souperstition/pretty-print)

listing.name: Clockify Integration for Trello
listing.description:
About
----------------

Clockify integration for Trello is an easy way to operate with time tracker inside a Trello board. You don't need to have any browser extension anymore to make it work.

---

Features
----------------

- Basic
  - Just copy-paste your Clockify API Token and you are ready to go.
  - Start/stop timer inside a Trello card
  - Update time entry description or easily append a checklist item to it.
  - Select workspace, project, tags, billing options before the start
  - Showing a badge about running timer on the front of card
  - Remembers and preselects timer options per user per board
  - Basic work-log functionality
- Advanced
  - Two way synchronisation between Trello and Clockify
  - Automatically start/stop a timer when Trello card is drag and drop to a specified column
  - Remembers and preselects a timer options per Trello column or card on the board. The feature is user related
  - Switch plugin "license" from one board to another

---

Price
----------------

Annual billing:  for one board with unlimited members (5 days trial).

 - 4 ‚Ç¨/year - basic features
 - 10 ‚Ç¨/year - basic + advanced features

---

Support
----------------

If you have any feature suggestions or run into any problems, please get in touch with me by sending an email to tkostiushko@sm-act.com

---

Screenshots
----------------
[![Screenshot 1](https://trello-clockify.sm-act.com/assets/img/screenshots/screen1.png)](https://trello-clockify.sm-act.com/assets/img/screenshots/screen1.png)
[![Screenshot 1](https://trello-clockify.sm-act.com/assets/img/screenshots/screen2.png)](https://trello-clockify.sm-act.com/assets/img/screenshots/screen2.png)

Print Board gives you the ability to get a printable overview of your board.

Print Board is **free**. Please also check out our other [PowerUps](https://powerupfortrello.com/).

You can select which **list** to print. 
You can also select which of the below **field** to print
- List Name
- Card Name
- Card Description
- Labels
- Members
- Due Date
- Due Complete
- Last Active Date

![](https://cdn.glitch.com/95123e9b-906a-4bff-a84e-3f3b57469fc4%2FPrintBoard.gif?v=1608676163802)

#### Protect your data

 [PowerUpForTrello](https://powerupfortrello.com/) is committed to managing your data securely and transparently. Print Board does not store any of your content. in fact, it never hit our servers. We also do not have any third-party tracking.



[Made with ‚ô• CALIFORNIA MMXX](https://powerupfortrello.com/)

# Your contact app inside Trello card

[Contalist](https://contalist.com) is a simple app that can help you manage your contact data and do contact related tasks easily. With this PowerUp, you can

## üë• Bring contacts to your cards

- üôã Link contacts to your cards
- üìò Manage your contact data in one place, no more copy & paste

![Contalist Contact fields in card](https://contalist.com/trello/images/powerup-screenshot.png)

üëÜ Look, a contact section inside your card. You can link contacts, clients, contractors, etc. to your cards, view and edit their profiles without leaving Trello.

---

## And we can do more help

### üõé Add **action/shortcut buttons** to your card
- Send email & text messages to your contacts from message templates in one click

### ü§ñ Automation
- üïñ Schedule messages to your contacts based on the due date
- üîÅ Send notifications when a card is moved into another list
- üí¨ Send messages when someone leaves a comment on your card

For more information, please contact us at [support@contalist.com](mailto:support@contalist.com).

Card Description: Estoy cargando la factura pero no me da opci√≥n de cargar la percepci√≥n

Fact proveedor


--------


---
[5:22 p.¬†m., 1/7/2022] German Motomel Roca: Esta tiene percepci√≥n en NQN...pero puede tener en m√°s de 1 provincia
[5:22 p.¬†m., 1/7/2022] German Motomel Roca: En nuestro caso en RIO NEGRO Y NEUQUEN
---
proveedor nos hace en sus facturas? En particular de IIBB, pero podr√≠a aplicar tambi√©n a ganancias o IVA.
---
La √∫nica forma que se me ocurre es crear Servicios habilitados para la compra (yo no uso los Servicios como productos en mi instalaci√≥n) y usar como l√≠neas en las facturas de los proveedores √©stos Servicios para reflejar lo pagado por las percepciones. Luego en cuanto a la contabilidad no quedar√≠a otra que trabajarlos manualmente filtrando lo pagado por cada tributo y/o jurisdici√≥n.
Todavia no tengo terminado el modulo, pero lo que hago por el momento para Percepciones, es crear un producto por ej: PER_IIBB con precio de compra 1$ e iva 0, y cuando agrego el producto en la factura de proveedor en cantidad pongo el valor de la Percepcion.

Para Retenciones, creo una cuenta para cada retecion y la agrego como pagos.
Yo tambien para las retenciones, me cree una caja y en la forma de pago, lo separo.

-------------

Para que tome las alicuotas de percepcion para cada cliente hacer los siguientes cambios:

reemplazar en facture.class.php:

$localtaxes_type=getLocalTaxesFromRate($txtva,0,$this->thirdparty, $mysoc);
por
$localtaxes_type=array(1,$this->client->localtax1_value,1,$this->client->localtax2_value,0);


reemplazar en facture.php:
$localtax1_rate = get_localtax($vat_rate, 1, $object->thirdparty);
$localtax2_rate = get_localtax($vat_rate, 2, $object->thirdparty);
por:
$localtax1_rate = $object->client->localtax1_value ?: get_localtax($vat_rate, 1, $object->thirdparty);
$localtax2_rate = $object->client->localtax2_value ?: get_localtax($vat_rate, 2, $object->thirdparty);

Todavia no tengo el php para subir las alicuotas.

--------------
nqn

Art√≠culo 11¬∫: Las al√≠cuotas aplicables para determinar la percepci√≥n sobre el importe neto de la operaci√≥n conforme lo
establecido en el Art√≠culo 8¬∫) ser√°n:
a) Contribuyentes Directos: 2 % ( dos por ciento ).-
b) Contribuyentes comprendidos en el r√©gimen de Convenio Multilateral: 1% ( uno por ciento ).-
c) Contribuyentes no inscriptos o que no acrediten su condici√≥n de acuerdo al art√≠culo 7¬∫: 2% (DOS POR CIENTO).

Base de la percepci√≥n

Art√≠culo 8 ‚Äì La base de la percepci√≥n estar√° constituida por el monto total de la operaci√≥n, excluido el impuesto al valor agregado ‚Äìcuando √©ste se encuentre discriminado en la factura o documento equivalente‚Äì.
Al√≠cuotas aplicables

c) Cuatro por ciento (4%) a sujetos que no acrediten su situaci√≥n fiscal como contribuyentes directos del impuesto sobre los ingresos brutos de la jurisdicci√≥n Neuqu√©n o constancia de inscripci√≥n o alta en la jurisdicci√≥n (CM-01) en contribuyentes del r√©gimen de Convenio Multilateral.

cards.desc:
Pasos para implementar un ERP en tu empresa
foto
1. Planificaci√≥n

En esta etapa se determinar√°n los recursos del proyecto, tanto t√©cnicos como humanos. Adem√°s, se definir√°n todas las actividades de las que consta el proyecto con sus respectivas fechas de inicio y fin.

De este modo se puede organizar todos los recursos en base a esas tareas y conocer la evoluci√≥n del proyecto.

Se recomienda adem√°s dejar instalado el software en esta fase para garantizar desde el principio su correcto funcionamiento.

2. Consultor√≠a y entendimiento de negocio

En este punto los consultores de negocio realizan un an√°lisis de las funcionalidades que necesita tu empresa y, que, por lo tanto, deber√°n ser implantadas en el ERP.

El servicio de consultor√≠a se realiza antes, durante y despu√©s de la implantaci√≥n del ERP.

El objetivo de esta etapa es llegar a un entendimiento com√∫n entre el equipo especialista del sistema y el equipo experto de la empresa, para saber cu√°les son los procesos actuales de la empresa y cu√°les son sus expectativas con respecto a la implementaci√≥n del ERP.

3. Configuraci√≥n y parametrizaci√≥n

foto
En esta etapa se realiza la instalaci√≥n del hardware y software en base al dise√±o de la soluci√≥n creada en la etapa anterior.

Adem√°s, esta fase deber√° ser la indicada para llevar a cabo pruebas de lo configurado, as√≠ como pruebas de cualquier desarrollo o integraci√≥n con otros sistemas que se haya requerido.

4. Migraci√≥n de datos

Este punto es uno de los m√°s importantes en este proceso. La calidad de los datos a migrar y las distintas codificaciones del sistema anterior exigen un esfuerzo para poder identificar correctamente el origen de cada dato, depurarlos e insertarlos en la nueva base de datos del ERP.

cards.desc:
Nuestro equipo especializado trabaja para garantizar una implementaci√≥n  exitosa disminuyendo los riesgos. El m√©todo utilizado consta de tres grandes etapas, cada una con sus respectivas fases:

Primera Etapa: Preparaci√≥n de base
En esta fase primaria nos encargaremos de instalar los primeros ladrillos para la construcci√≥n del Software de Gesti√≥n ERP. Es de suma importancia para proseguir con las siguientes fases. Son cuatro pasos definidos:

Migraci√≥n de datos

Nos encargamos de transferir informaci√≥n de un sistema de gesti√≥n antiguo a nuestro ERP. Los problemas que suceden frecuentemente son que el cliente no tiene definido los procedimientos fundamentales que ser√°n enriquecidos. Otra posible posibilidad es que los datos anteriores son incompatibles con el software nuevo, o el presupuesto no alcanza para la totalidad de conversi√≥n.

Pre-Parametrizaci√≥n

La Pre-Parametrizaci√≥n es la etapa m√°s importante para la implementaci√≥n del Software. All√≠ conoceremos cu√°les son los procesos del cliente que son de vital importancia para la funci√≥n administrativa. Al tener estos datos, adaptamos el Software a los requerimientos de la empresa. Nosotros suministraremos un cuestionario de pre-parametrizaci√≥n que se encargar√° de esclarecer dichos procesos para evitar cualquier riesgo en la implementaci√≥n.

Instalaci√≥n

Conocer donde instalaremos la soluci√≥n de gesti√≥n es importante. En nuestro cao, ofrecemos dos opciones de instalaci√≥n: la primera en un servidor f√≠sico propio de la empresa, y la segunda  en la nube, cada una con sus ventajas y desventajas.

El servidor f√≠sico debe contar con los requisitos adecuados para un excelente funcionamiento. Si no los posee deber√° compra uno nuevo, aumentando los gastos de implementaci√≥n. En la nube se obvia este paso pero es importante contar con un internet apropiado, ya que, depender√° mucho de la funci√≥n del ERP.

Configuraci√≥n

Al tener instalado el software procederemos a configurar sus caracter√≠sticas de acuerdo a los conocimientos proporcionados en la fase de pre-parametrizaci√≥n. Con esto termina la primera etapa de nuestra implementaci√≥n.

Segunda Etapa: Capacitaci√≥n y puesta a punto
Capacitaci√≥n

En esta instancia, nos encargaremos de educar al personal que va a trabajar con el Software de Gesti√≥n ERP. Para ello contamos con un equipo de instructores especializados que ir√°n hasta tu empresa para capacitar a tu personal de manera presencial. Tambi√©n contamos con videos y webinars en nuestra p√°gina web que pueden ser muy √∫tiles n esta etapa.

Puesta a punto

Antes de iniciar la puesta en marcha del software, verificaremos con un ejercicio piloto si los requerimientos del cliente est√°n debidamente implementados. Tambi√©n conoceremos si existen errores para solucionarlos, y por √∫ltimo si todo el sistema marcha perfectamente.

Tercer Etapa: Puesta en marcha
Ahora iniciaremos el Software de Gesti√≥n ERP en el d√≠a a d√≠a de la empresa. Estaremos al tanto de cualquier irregularidad. Para ello contamos con un soporte t√©cnico entrenado para cualquier irregularidad. Nuestro servicio de atenci√≥n al cliente es personalizado y trabaja todos los d√≠as de la semana.

Desde la fase de planificaci√≥n hasta la puesta en marcha, existen muchos riesgos que comprometen el funcionamiento del EPR. En Flexxus estamos al tanto de cada uno de ellos y tomamos las medidas necesarias para disminuir este tipo de incidencia.

Por todas estas razones, podemos decir con certeza que cumplimos con las claves para una implementaci√≥n exitosa un Software de Gesti√≥n ERP. En Flexxus el profesionalismo y la efectividad est√°n garantizados.
